span.h1:
UPDATE (April 9, 2020):
North Kansas City Schools will be closed through Friday, May 22.

p.strong: Per Governor Michael Parson’s announcement this afternoon, NKC Schools building closures due to the coronavirus have been extended through the end of the school year. E-Learning and food distribution will continue through May 22, 2020 and we will finish strong! Read more about this order from the Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education.

Additional information will be shared soon, particularly regarding plans for senior celebrations, summer school and more. Thank you for your continued patience and understanding as we navigate these ever-changing times.

span.p: This page will continue to be updated as necessary with important information and any additional details. Questions and concerns can be directed to the district's Let's Talk site.

li.a: April 9 Message: NKC Schools Closed Through May 22
April 7 Parent Message: Meal Distribution Change
April 6 Message: Update from Dr. Clemens (Video)
April 2 Parent Message: Survey Results, Redefining Mondays & Grading FAQs
March 27 Message: Update from Dr. Clemens (Video)
March 20 Parent Message: Meal Delivery and Pick Up
March 19 Message: Update from Dr. Clemens (Video)
March 17 Parent Message: Information on Resources & Support During Closure
March 16 Parent Message: NKC Schools Closed Through April 3
March 13 Parent Message: From the Superintendent
March 8 Parent Message: Coronavirus Precautions & Travel

p.span: North Kansas City Schools is closely monitoring information regarding the global spread of the coronavirus and proactively working with our local health agencies to develop a plan of action.

br.a: View the NKC Schools Action Plan

span.p: The Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services (DHSS) activated a statewide public hotline for citizens or providers needing guidance regarding the novel coronavirus, or COVID-19. The hotline can be reached at 877-435-8411 and is being operated by medical professionals. It is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

Please view this information from the Missouri Department of Health and Human Services, as well as details on what schools should know about coronavirus. Clay County Public Health also has a webpage dedicated to information on COVID-19. The City of Kansas City, MO has information on its health department webpage as well. The American Public Health Association is also offering helpful information on their website's COVID-19 page.

For tips on how to talk with children about the virus, view the SAMSHA fact sheet, available in English and Spanish. Feel free to contact your student's school counselor with any concerns that you may have.

p.br: Department of Labor - Families First Coronavirus Response ACT (FFCRA)
